ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Title: Finch
ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Abstract: A Web Processing Service for Climate Indicators

wps:Process.ows:Title: Humidex index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The humidex indicates how hot the air feels to an average person, accounting for the effect of humidity. It can be loosely interpreted as the equivalent perceived temperature when the air is dry.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average temperature from minimum and maximum temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: We assume a symmetrical distribution for the temperature and retrieve the average value as Tg = (Tx + Tn) / 2

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wind speed and direction from the eastward and northward wind components.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Computes the magnitude and angle of the wind vector from its northward and eastward components, following the meteorological convention that sets calm wind to a direction of 0deg and northerly wind to 360deg.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Eastward and northward wind components from the wind speed and direction.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Compute the eastward and northward wind components from the wind speed and direction.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relative humidity from temperature and dewpoint temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Compute relative humidity from temperature and either dewpoint temperature or specific humidity and pressure through the saturation vapor pressure.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Relative humidity from temperature, pressure and specific humidity.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Compute relative humidity from temperature and either dewpoint temperature or specific humidity and pressure through the saturation vapor pressure.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snowfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Solid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rainfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Liquid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method. This is a convenience method based on `snowfall_approximation`, see the latter for details.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wind chill index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The Wind Chill Index is an estimation of how cold the weather feels to the average person. It is computed from the air temperature and the 10-m wind. As defined by the Environment and Climate Change Canada ([MVSZ15]_), two equations exist, the conventional one and one for slow winds (usually < 5 km/h), see Notes.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of rain on frozen ground events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with rain above a threshold after a series of seven days below freezing temperature. Precipitation is assumed to be rain when the temperature is above 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest 1-day precipitation amount for a period (frequency).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily total precipitation temperature series by taking the max over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation amount cumulated over a n-day moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-day rolling sum of the original daily total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the total number of days during period with precipitation over threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days with daily precipitation below threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Consecutive wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the maximum number of consecutive wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where precipitation is below a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average daily precipitation intensity.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the average precipitation over wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation intensity over a n-hour moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-hour rolling average of the original hourly total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated total precipitation (solid and liquid)
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated liquid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated solid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Last day with solid precipitation above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the last day of a period where the solid precipitation exceeds a threshold. WARNING: The default freq is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day with solid precipitation above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the first day of a period where the solid precipitation exceeds a threshold. WARNING: The default `freq` is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Days with snowfall
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the number of days where snowfall is within low and high thresholds.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of wet days with daily precipitation over a given percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days over period where the precipitation is above a threshold defining wet days and above a given percentile for that day.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with precipitation above threshold and temperature below threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where precipitation is greater or equal to some threshold, and temperatures are colder than some threshold. This can be used for example to identify days with the potential for freezing rain or icing conditions.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Fraction of precipitation due to wet days with daily precipitation over a given percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Percentage of the total precipitation over period occurring in days where the precipitation is above a threshold defining wet days and above a given percentile for that day.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ratio of rainfall to total precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The ratio of total liquid precipitation over the total precipitation. Liquid precipitation is approximated from total precipitation on days where temperature is above a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmax above a threshold (number of summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tmax below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with both hot maximum and minimum daily temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days per period with tasmin above a threshold and tasmax above another threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave max length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Maximum length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave total length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Total length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days. This the sum of all days in such events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days that are part of a heatwave, defined as five or more consecutive days over 25.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Hot spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of hot spells over a given period. A hot spell is defined as an event where the maximum daily temperature exceeds a specific threshold over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Longest hot spell.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Longest spell of high temperatures over a given period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily average temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean temperature series by taking the mean over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum value of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The minimum of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extreme intra-period temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of max temperature (TXx) minus the minimum of min temperature (TNn) for the given time period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with at least six consecutive days where the daily minimum temperature is below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days that are part of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold in degC.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Statistics of consecutive diurnal temperature swing events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frequency of freeze-thaw spells
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Averge length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximal length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cooling degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days above the temperature threshold at which spaces are cooled.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heating degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days below the temperature threshold at which spaces are heated.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing degree-days over threshold temperature value.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The sum of degree-days over the threshold temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day consistently exceeding threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature threshold is exceeded over a given number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost days index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least N (def: 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature under a threshold (default: 0) and the first occurrence of at least N (def 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature above the same threshold A mid date can be given to limit the earliest day the end of season can take. WARNING: The default freq and mid_date values are valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Last day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns last day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days and limited to a final calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures superior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is superior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of ice/freezing days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost days (Tn < 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the temperature is under a certain threshold (default: 0degC). WARNING: The default freq value is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost free days (Tn > 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the minimum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature over a threshold (default: 5) and the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature below the same threshold after a certain date. (Usually July 1st in the northern emisphere and January 1st in the southern hemisphere.)

wps:Process.ows:Title: End of the growing season.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of the year of the start of a sequence of days with a temperature consistently below a threshold, after a period with temperatures consistently above the same threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Degree days exceedance date.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when the sum of degree days exceeds a threshold. Degree days are computed above or below a given temperature threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Warm spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days inside spells of a minimum number of consecutive days where the daily maximum temperature is above the 90th percentile. The 90th percentile should be computed for a 5-day moving window, centered on each calendar day in the 1961-1990 period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive days with tasmax above a threshold (summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the maximum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Fire season mask.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Binary mask of the active fire season, defined by conditions on consecutive daily temperatures and, optionally, snow depths.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Corn heat units.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Temperature-based index used to estimate the development of corn crops.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with snow depth above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where surface snow depth is greater or equal to given threshold. WARNING: The default `freq` is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Start date of continuous snow cover.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when snow depth is above `threshold` for at least `window` consecutive days. WARNING: The default `freq` is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: End date of continuous snow cover.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: First day after the start of the continuous snow cover when snow depth is below `threshold` for at least `window` consecutive days. WARNING: The default `freq` is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum snow depth day of year.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when surface snow reaches its peak value. If snow depth is 0 over entire period, return NaN.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum snow melt
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum snow melt over a given number of days expressed in snow water equivalent.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum snow melt and precipitation
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum snow melt plus precipitation over a given number of days expressed in snow water equivalent.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Days with snowfall over threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with snowfall accumulation greater or equal to threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Days with blowing snow events
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where both snowfall over the last days and daily wind speeds are above respective thresholds.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Base flow index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the base flow index, defined as the minimum 7-day average flow divided by the mean flow.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Flow values for given return periods.
Richards-Baker flashiness index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Measures oscillations in flow relative to total flow, quantifying the frequency and rapidity of short term changes in flow.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Statistic of the daily flow on a given period.
Distribution parameters fitted over the time dimension.
Day of year of the maximum.
Day of year of the minimum.
Total sea ice extent.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sea ice extent measures the *ice-covered* area, where a region is considered ice-covered if its sea ice concentration is above a threshold usually set to 15%.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Total sea ice area.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sea ice area measures the total sea ice covered area where sea ice concentration is above a threshold, usually set to 15%.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Empirical Quantile Mapping bias-adjustment
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Adjustment factors are computed between the quantiles of `ref` and `sim`.Values of `sim` are matched to the corresponding quantiles of `hist` and corrected accordingly.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average temperature from minimum and maximum temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: We assume a symmetrical distribution for the temperature and retrieve the average value as Tg = (Tx + Tn) / 2

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snowfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Solid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rainfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Liquid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method. This is a convenience method based on `snowfall_approximation`, see the latter for details.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of rain on frozen ground events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with rain above a threshold after a series of seven days below freezing temperature. Precipitation is assumed to be rain when the temperature is above 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest 1-day precipitation amount for a period (frequency).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily total precipitation temperature series by taking the max over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation amount cumulated over a n-day moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-day rolling sum of the original daily total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the total number of days during period with precipitation over threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days with daily precipitation below threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Consecutive wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the maximum number of consecutive wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where precipitation is below a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average daily precipitation intensity.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the average precipitation over wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation intensity over a n-hour moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-hour rolling average of the original hourly total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated total precipitation (solid and liquid)
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated liquid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated solid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with precipitation above threshold and temperature below threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where precipitation is greater or equal to some threshold, and temperatures are colder than some threshold. This can be used for example to identify days with the potential for freezing rain or icing conditions.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ratio of rainfall to total precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The ratio of total liquid precipitation over the total precipitation. Liquid precipitation is approximated from total precipitation on days where temperature is above a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmax above a threshold (number of summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tmax below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with both hot maximum and minimum daily temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days per period with tasmin above a threshold and tasmax above another threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave max length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Maximum length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave total length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Total length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days. This the sum of all days in such events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days that are part of a heatwave, defined as five or more consecutive days over 25.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Hot spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of hot spells over a given period. A hot spell is defined as an event where the maximum daily temperature exceeds a specific threshold over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Longest hot spell.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Longest spell of high temperatures over a given period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily average temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean temperature series by taking the mean over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum value of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The minimum of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extreme intra-period temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of max temperature (TXx) minus the minimum of min temperature (TNn) for the given time period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with at least six consecutive days where the daily minimum temperature is below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days that are part of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold in degC.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Statistics of consecutive diurnal temperature swing events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frequency of freeze-thaw spells
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Averge length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximal length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cooling degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days above the temperature threshold at which spaces are cooled.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heating degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days below the temperature threshold at which spaces are heated.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing degree-days over threshold temperature value.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The sum of degree-days over the threshold temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day consistently exceeding threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature threshold is exceeded over a given number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost days index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least N (def: 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature under a threshold (default: 0) and the first occurrence of at least N (def 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature above the same threshold A mid date can be given to limit the earliest day the end of season can take. WARNING: The default freq and mid_date values are valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Last day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns last day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days and limited to a final calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures superior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is superior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of ice/freezing days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost days (Tn < 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the temperature is under a certain threshold (default: 0degC). WARNING: The default freq value is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost free days (Tn > 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the minimum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature over a threshold (default: 5) and the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature below the same threshold after a certain date. (Usually July 1st in the northern emisphere and January 1st in the southern hemisphere.)

wps:Process.ows:Title: End of the growing season.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of the year of the start of a sequence of days with a temperature consistently below a threshold, after a period with temperatures consistently above the same threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Degree days exceedance date.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when the sum of degree days exceeds a threshold. Degree days are computed above or below a given temperature threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Warm spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days inside spells of a minimum number of consecutive days where the daily maximum temperature is above the 90th percentile. The 90th percentile should be computed for a 5-day moving window, centered on each calendar day in the 1961-1990 period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive days with tasmax above a threshold (summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the maximum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Corn heat units.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Temperature-based index used to estimate the development of corn crops.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average temperature from minimum and maximum temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: We assume a symmetrical distribution for the temperature and retrieve the average value as Tg = (Tx + Tn) / 2

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snowfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Solid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rainfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Liquid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method. This is a convenience method based on `snowfall_approximation`, see the latter for details.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of rain on frozen ground events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with rain above a threshold after a series of seven days below freezing temperature. Precipitation is assumed to be rain when the temperature is above 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest 1-day precipitation amount for a period (frequency).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily total precipitation temperature series by taking the max over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation amount cumulated over a n-day moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-day rolling sum of the original daily total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the total number of days during period with precipitation over threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days with daily precipitation below threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Consecutive wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the maximum number of consecutive wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where precipitation is below a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average daily precipitation intensity.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the average precipitation over wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation intensity over a n-hour moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-hour rolling average of the original hourly total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated total precipitation (solid and liquid)
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated liquid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated solid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with precipitation above threshold and temperature below threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where precipitation is greater or equal to some threshold, and temperatures are colder than some threshold. This can be used for example to identify days with the potential for freezing rain or icing conditions.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ratio of rainfall to total precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The ratio of total liquid precipitation over the total precipitation. Liquid precipitation is approximated from total precipitation on days where temperature is above a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmax above a threshold (number of summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tmax below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with both hot maximum and minimum daily temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days per period with tasmin above a threshold and tasmax above another threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave max length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Maximum length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave total length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Total length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days. This the sum of all days in such events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days that are part of a heatwave, defined as five or more consecutive days over 25.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Hot spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of hot spells over a given period. A hot spell is defined as an event where the maximum daily temperature exceeds a specific threshold over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Longest hot spell.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Longest spell of high temperatures over a given period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily average temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean temperature series by taking the mean over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum value of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The minimum of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extreme intra-period temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of max temperature (TXx) minus the minimum of min temperature (TNn) for the given time period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with at least six consecutive days where the daily minimum temperature is below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days that are part of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold in degC.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Statistics of consecutive diurnal temperature swing events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frequency of freeze-thaw spells
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Averge length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximal length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cooling degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days above the temperature threshold at which spaces are cooled.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heating degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days below the temperature threshold at which spaces are heated.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing degree-days over threshold temperature value.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The sum of degree-days over the threshold temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day consistently exceeding threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature threshold is exceeded over a given number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost days index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least N (def: 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature under a threshold (default: 0) and the first occurrence of at least N (def 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature above the same threshold A mid date can be given to limit the earliest day the end of season can take. WARNING: The default freq and mid_date values are valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Last day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns last day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days and limited to a final calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures superior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is superior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of ice/freezing days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost days (Tn < 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the temperature is under a certain threshold (default: 0degC). WARNING: The default freq value is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost free days (Tn > 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the minimum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature over a threshold (default: 5) and the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature below the same threshold after a certain date. (Usually July 1st in the northern emisphere and January 1st in the southern hemisphere.)

wps:Process.ows:Title: End of the growing season.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of the year of the start of a sequence of days with a temperature consistently below a threshold, after a period with temperatures consistently above the same threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Degree days exceedance date.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when the sum of degree days exceeds a threshold. Degree days are computed above or below a given temperature threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Warm spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days inside spells of a minimum number of consecutive days where the daily maximum temperature is above the 90th percentile. The 90th percentile should be computed for a 5-day moving window, centered on each calendar day in the 1961-1990 period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive days with tasmax above a threshold (summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the maximum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Corn heat units.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Temperature-based index used to estimate the development of corn crops.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average temperature from minimum and maximum temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: We assume a symmetrical distribution for the temperature and retrieve the average value as Tg = (Tx + Tn) / 2

wps:Process.ows:Title: Snowfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Solid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Rainfall approximation from total precipitation and temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Liquid precipitation estimated from precipitation and temperature according to a given method. This is a convenience method based on `snowfall_approximation`, see the latter for details.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of rain on frozen ground events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with rain above a threshold after a series of seven days below freezing temperature. Precipitation is assumed to be rain when the temperature is above 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest 1-day precipitation amount for a period (frequency).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily total precipitation temperature series by taking the max over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation amount cumulated over a n-day moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-day rolling sum of the original daily total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the total number of days during period with precipitation over threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days with daily precipitation below threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Consecutive wet days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns the maximum number of consecutive wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive dry days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where precipitation is below a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average daily precipitation intensity.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the average precipitation over wet days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest precipitation intensity over a n-hour moving window.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Calculate the n-hour rolling average of the original hourly total precipitation series and determine the maximum value over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated total precipitation (solid and liquid)
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated liquid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Accumulated solid precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean precipitation flux and accumulate over each period. If a daily temperature is provided, the `phase` keyword can be used to sum precipitation of a given phase only. When the temperature is under the provided threshold, precipitation is assumed to be snow, and liquid rain otherwise. This indice is agnostic to the type of daily temperature (tas, tasmax or tasmin) given.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with precipitation above threshold and temperature below threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where precipitation is greater or equal to some threshold, and temperatures are colder than some threshold. This can be used for example to identify days with the potential for freezing rain or icing conditions.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Ratio of rainfall to total precipitation.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The ratio of total liquid precipitation over the total precipitation. Liquid precipitation is approximated from total precipitation on days where temperature is above a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas above a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tas below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily mean temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmax above a threshold (number of summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tmax below a threshold.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperature is below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with both hot maximum and minimum daily temperatures.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days per period with tasmin above a threshold and tasmax above another threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave max length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Maximum length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave total length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Total length of heat waves over a given period. A heat wave is defined as an event where the minimum and maximum daily temperature both exceeds specific thresholds over a minimum number of days. This the sum of all days in such events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heat wave index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days that are part of a heatwave, defined as five or more consecutive days over 25.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Hot spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of hot spells over a given period. A hot spell is defined as an event where the maximum daily temperature exceeds a specific threshold over a minimum number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Longest hot spell.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Longest spell of high temperatures over a given period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily average temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Resample the original daily mean temperature series by taking the mean over each period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest mean temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily mean temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum value of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest max temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The minimum of daily maximum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Highest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Lowest minimum temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Minimum of daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum of daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The mean difference between the daily maximum temperature and the daily minimum temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Mean absolute day-to-day variation in daily temperature range.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Extreme intra-period temperature range.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum of max temperature (TXx) minus the minimum of min temperature (TNn) for the given time period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with at least six consecutive days where the daily minimum temperature is below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days that are part of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold in degC.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cold spell frequency.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of cold spell events, defined as a sequence of consecutive days with mean daily temperature below a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Statistics of consecutive diurnal temperature swing events.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frequency of freeze-thaw spells
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Averge length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximal length of freeze-thaw spells.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: A diurnal swing of max and min temperature event is when Tmax > thresh_tasmax and Tmin<= thresh_tasmin. This indice finds all days that constitute these events and computes statistics over the length and frequency of these events.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Cooling degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days above the temperature threshold at which spaces are cooled.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Heating degree days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Sum of degree days below the temperature threshold at which spaces are heated.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing degree-days over threshold temperature value.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The sum of degree-days over the threshold temperature.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day consistently exceeding threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature threshold is exceeded over a given number of days.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost days index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Frost season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least N (def: 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature under a threshold (default: 0) and the first occurrence of at least N (def 5) consecutive days with minimum daily temperature above the same threshold A mid date can be given to limit the earliest day the end of season can take. WARNING: The default freq and mid_date values are valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Last day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns last day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days and limited to a final calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures inferior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is inferior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: First day of temperatures superior to a threshold temperature.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Returns first day of period where a temperature is superior to a threshold over a given number of days, limited to a starting calendar date.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of ice/freezing days.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily maximum temperatures are below 0.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost days (Tn < 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the temperature is under a certain threshold (default: 0degC). WARNING: The default freq value is valid for the northern hemisphere.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive frost free days (Tn > 0).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the minimum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Growing season length.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: The number of days between the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature over a threshold (default: 5) and the first occurrence of at least six consecutive days with mean daily temperature below the same threshold after a certain date. (Usually July 1st in the northern emisphere and January 1st in the southern hemisphere.)

wps:Process.ows:Title: End of the growing season.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of the year of the start of a sequence of days with a temperature consistently below a threshold, after a period with temperatures consistently above the same threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with tasmin above a threshold (number of tropical nights).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days where daily minimum temperature exceeds a threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily mean temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily maximum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature over the 90th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days with daily minimum temperature below the 10th percentile.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Degree days exceedance date.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Day of year when the sum of degree days exceeds a threshold. Degree days are computed above or below a given temperature threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Warm spell duration index.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Number of days inside spells of a minimum number of consecutive days where the daily maximum temperature is above the 90th percentile. The 90th percentile should be computed for a 5-day moving window, centered on each calendar day in the 1961-1990 period.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Maximum number of consecutive days with tasmax above a threshold (summer days).
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the maximum number of consecutive days within the period where the maximum temperature is above a certain threshold.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Corn heat units.
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Temperature-based index used to estimate the development of corn crops.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset of grid cells from a dataset, using a list of coordinates
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: For the the given dataset, return the closest grid cell for each provided coordinates pair, for the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset of BCCAQv2 datasets grid cells using a list of coordinates
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: For the BCCAQv2 datasets, return the closest grid cell for each provided coordinates pair, for the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset of a dataset, using a bounding box
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: For the given dataset, return the data for which grid cells intersect the bounding box for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset of BCCAQv2 datasets, using a bounding box
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: For the BCCAQv2 datasets, return the data for which grid cells intersect the bounding box for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: BCCAQv2 grid cell heat wave frequency computation***Deprecated*** to be removed in a future release
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Compute heat wave frequency for all the BCCAQv2 datasets for a single grid cell.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset with bounding box
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the data for which grid cells intersect the bounding box for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset with a grid point
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the data for which grid cells includes the point coordinates for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Subset with one or more polygons
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the data for which grid cells center are within the polygon for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.

wps:Process.ows:Title: Average over one or more polygons
wps:Process.ows:Abstract: Return the average of the data within each polygons, taking into account partial overlaps and holes, for each input dataset as well as the time range selected.
